docs.lead_paragraph: A Federal appeals court today restored protections for nonsmokers on airliners, 16 months after the Civil Aeronautics Board dropped them in favor of self-regulation by the airlines. The three-judge panel of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia ruled unanimously that the C.A.B. had improperly rescinded protections against cigar and pipe smoke, poor ventilation and drifting smoke.
